Ackland Art Museum, 1958-1996

Includes materials and photographs related to the Ackland Renovation in the 1990s and exhibits on display and ongoing public activities at the time.

Activism

Includes materials on student unrest at UNC during the late 1960s, including the list of demands presented by the Black Student Movement to Chancellor Sitterson (and Sitterson's reply), flyers advertising the boycott of Lenoir Dining Hall during the Worker Strike of 1969, magazines, political cartoons, and articles published by student activists (radicals and reactionaries; ex. two copies of 'The Protean'), internal reporting on student unrest by the News Bureau on two radical campus organizations, SOSC and NUC, and other miscellaneous items.

Animal Rights

Includes a transcript of a press conference given by the Animal Protection Society of Orange County in the Student Union on the subject of the use of animals in research, several communiques to Chancellor Hardin and the Board of Governors from various animal rights organizations in the county and state, internal communications from Dr. Patricia Poteat (Associate Vice Chancellor for Research) regarding animal rights protests and the need for a better public info. program concerning animal use at UNC, an internal communication from Chancellor Hardin regarding receipt of a letter from PETA alleging animal abuse at UNC, and finally several letters to Congressman David Price from UNC Faculty on the subject of use of animals in research.
